topics.topic_html:
Here's a list of common DOM functions in JavaScript, organized by category. This includes methods from various interfaces such as Document, Element, and Node.

Element Selection

  1. getElementById()
  2. getElementsByClassName()
  3. getElementsByTagName()
  4. querySelector()
  5. querySelectorAll()
  6. getRootNode()

Element Manipulation

  1. appendChild()
  2. removeChild()
  3. replaceChild()
  4. cloneNode()
  5. insertBefore()
  6. insertAdjacentElement()
  7. insertAdjacentHTML()
  8. insertAdjacentText()
  9. setInnerHTML()
  10. setTextContent()

Attributes and Properties

  1. getAttribute()
  2. setAttribute()
  3. removeAttribute()
  4. hasAttribute()
  5. getAttributeNS()
  6. setAttributeNS()
  7. removeAttributeNS()
  8. classList.add()
  9. classList.remove()
  10. classList.toggle()
  11. classList.contains()
  12. classList.item()
  13. classList.replace()

Styling

  1. style.setProperty()
  2. style.getPropertyValue()
  3. style.removeProperty()
  4. getComputedStyle()
  5. scrollIntoView()

Event Handling

  1. addEventListener()
  2. removeEventListener()
  3. dispatchEvent()
  4. EventTarget.dispatchEvent()

Document Structure

  1. createElement()
  2. createTextNode()
  3. createComment()
  4. createDocumentFragment()
  5. document.open()
  6. document.close()
  7. document.write()
  8. document.writeln()
  9. document.importNode()
  10. document.adoptNode()

Traversing Nodes

  1. parentNode
  2. childNodes
  3. firstChild
  4. lastChild
  5. nextSibling
  6. previousSibling
  7. children
  8. firstElementChild
  9. lastElementChild
  10. nextElementSibling
  11. previousElementSibling

Other Functions

  1. document.querySelector()
  2. document.querySelectorAll()
  3. document.getElementsByName()
  4. document.getElementsByTagNameNS()
  5. document.createEvent()
  6. document.activeElement
  7. document.hasFocus()
  8. document.body
  9. document.title
  10. document.location
  11. document.referrer
  12. document.cookie
  13. document.domain
  14. document.URL
  15. document.head

Miscellaneous

  1. Element.scrollTop
  2. Element.scrollLeft
  3. Element.clientHeight
  4. Element.clientWidth
  5. Element.offsetHeight
  6. Element.offsetWidth

More Element Manipulation

  1. setAttributeNode()
  2. removeAttributeNode()
  3. hasAttributes()
  4. Element.before()
  5. Element.after()
  6. Element.replaceWith()
  7. Element.remove()
  8. Element.getElementsByTagName()
  9. Element.getElementsByClassName()

More Attributes and Properties

  1. Element.getAttributeNames()
  2. Element.hasAttributes()
  3. Element.dataset (for data attributes)

More Event Handling

  1. Event.stopPropagation()
  2. Event.preventDefault()
  3. Event.stopImmediatePropagation()
  4. EventTarget.hasEventListener()

More Document Structure

  1. document.createRange()
  2. document.createNodeIterator()
  3. document.createTreeWalker()
  4. document.body.appendChild()
  5. document.body.removeChild()
  6. document.body.insertBefore()
  7. document.body.replaceChild()

More Traversing Nodes

  1. Node.isEqualNode()
  2. Node.isSameNode()
  3. Node.compareDocumentPosition()
  4. Node.contains()

More Miscellaneous

  1. Node.cloneNode()
  2. Node.normalize()
  3. Node.textContent
  4. Node.innerHTML
  5. Node.outerHTML
  6. Node.parentElement
  7. Node.nextElementSibling
  8. Node.previousElementSibling
  9. Node.childElementCount
  10. Node.children
  11. Node.hasChildNodes()
  12. Node.insertBefore()

More CSS and Styling

  1. Element.getComputedStyle()
  2. Element.getAnimations()
  3. Element.scrollHeight
  4. Element.scrollWidth
  5. Element.clientTop
  6. Element.clientLeft
  7. Element.getClientRects()

More Window and Document Methods

  1. window.requestAnimationFrame()
  2. window.cancelAnimationFrame()
  3. window.addEventListener()
  4. window.removeEventListener()
  5. window.scrollTo()
  6. window.scrollBy()

More for Document Fragments

  1. DocumentFragment.appendChild()
  2. DocumentFragment.querySelector()
  3. DocumentFragment.querySelectorAll()

Miscellaneous Functions

  1. document.execCommand()
  2. document.activeElement
  3. document.elementsFromPoint()
